text:
12 oz bottle with minimal sediment on the bottom. Pours near black with a thin , weak head. 
Very appealing aroma with a flavor to match, almost. Both have exceptional balance. Remarkably well hidden alcohol, Very smooth, full body. Strong roasted grain aftertaste.
Black with thin head. Aroma has some roasted malts and bitter chocolate. Flavour also has dark chocolate and a hint of coffee.
Pretty good.. Dark brown head. Slightly bitter. Not as creamy as most sweet stouts.
Dit is het soort stout waar ik echt van hou. Mooie chocolade koffie geur. De smaak biedt dezelfde koffie en volle chocolade met een romig mondgevoel. Voldoende zuren en bitters.

Bottle shared at home. Black with tan head. Sweet roasted choco malts, something almost burnt, big choc, toffee, taffee, coffee, rye. Softened by oats. Smooth. Sweet and light bitter. Over medium body and soft carbonation. Nice silky rich stout.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Black with brown head that doesnt last very long and leaves a thick film. Quite some roasted notes with ash, coffee, dark chocolate and burnt caramel. Also some vanilla cookies, marzipan, light sweet red berries. Taste is over medium sweet balanced with quite some roasted bitterness. Over medium bodied with creamy feel.

Bottle from Beergium. Pours opaque black with beige head that leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma of coffee, molasses, caramel fudge, vanilla and roast. Taste is dry and oaty with some roast and liquorice. Surprisingly thin body. Dry, roasted, liquorice finish.

Piana po nalaniu przyjmuje kształt bardzo ładnej, beżowej koronki, samo piwo ciemne, wręcz nieprzejrzyste. Przyjemny aromat kawy oraz paloności. W smaku podobnie z dodatkową czekoladową słodyczą. Wysycenie średnie w kierunku niskiego, dla mnie w punkt. Niezwykle pijalne, b. dobre piwo.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with light brown head. 
Aroma chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, oat, caramel. 
Taste caramel chocolate sweets, roasted bitter, some smoke. 
Mouthfeel thick, creamy. 
Great beer.

Total black body with thick beige two finger head.The body is full with some carbonation.Aromas of liquorice,vanilla,toasted bread,maltTastes malt sweetness,coffee,vanilla,alcohol, It is a little acidic but nothing to moan about.It leaves a bitterness at the end of the sip.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Almost pitch black pour with a tan head. Notes of sweet malts, caramel, chocolate, some tar, light ash and some roast.

Lovely scent of sweetness and chocolate. Celestial good taste of coffee, chocolate, sweetness and a little soy sauce. Wonderful bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Enjoyable beer. Very pleasant to drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma of dark sweet malts, coffee, slight smoke, and roasted notes. The taste is sweet and slight smoky, roasted malts, coffee, bitter chocolate and some liquorice. Pretty awesome sweet stout!

0.33 bottle.   Black color with a small, brownish head of good retention. A rich aroma of dark malts, dark chocolate, forest fruits, wood, some caramel, and a bit of oats. Taste is obviously malty, sweet, chocolaty, woody - not as rich as the aroma but still good. A full body, a thick texture, and an almost flat carbonation. Finish is medium long and less sweet, some molasses appears whereas most of the initial complexity vanishes. Overall the beer is good but it seems to diminish as one progresses with the tasting.

On tap at RCBW 2016. Dark brown, almost black colour. Small, beige head. Lots of chocolate, creamy notes, slight sweetness, very slight hints of vanilla in the aroma. Chocolaty, creamy beginning. Rather bitter in the middle. Bit smoke, burnt caramel in the end. Creamy texture. Rather medium bodied, quite interesting beer. Maybe even too less body.

Tap @RCBF 2016. Pitch black color. Small size, brown head, stays. Dark chocolate, sweet, fruity, cocoa beans and malty in aroma. Malty, dark chocolate, some hops, sweet, caramel and roast in taste. Hopping is very nice. Long lasting roast and dark chocolate in aftertaste. Very easy to drink. Alcohol is hidden. Very solid brew.

Superb full bodied brew for such a low ABV. Usually I like intense hard hitters, but this one is soooo smooth, coffee, cocoa, vanilla, some pine hop kick. MOderate to light sweetness with moderate bitterness
Bomb
Sweet and rich aroma. Bit empty in the end that is unexpected. Foam also not that rich. Otherwise decent.

Barwa ciemnobrązowa. Piana beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, niezbyt obfita, dość szybko opada. W aromacie dominuje czekolada, czuć też kawę i ciemne owoce. W smaku jest bardzo gładkie, aksamitne, są nuty kawy zbożowej, gorzkiej czekolady i paloności. Wysycenie na odpowiednim poziomie, goryczka jest wyraźnie zaznaczona, całkiem przyjemna.
12 oz bottle. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish.

Barwa ciemnobrązowa, z rubinowymi refleksami; piana ciemnobeżowa, niezbyt obfita. W aromacie owoce w czekoladzie, kawa. W smaku przyjemnie gładkie, czuć ten owies, jest paloność, gorzka czekolada, goryczka średnio wysoka. Dobre piwo.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do... hgw. ladna, ciemna, drobnopecherzykowa acz niewysoka i szybko opadajaca do obraczki piana, na ciemno brazowycm piwie. aromaty intensywne, jest i czekolada i kawa, do tego od razu czuc w zapachu, ze to owsiany stout. jest tez nieco ciemnych owocow w odleglejszym tle. w ustach dosc gladki, jak dla mnie ciut za wysoko, poszczypujaco wysycony i ciut nie dajacy tak intensywnych smakow jak aromat zdawal sie obiecywac. pojawia sie tez palonosc, ktorej w aromacie prawie nie bylo. niemalo ciala. goryczka odnotowywalna. "pol-slodki". fajne piwoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Aromas of chocolate, roasty oats, molasses, and dark fruits. Taste is bitter dark chocolate, roastiness, dark fruit and earth. Very good brew

Pours black color, slightly haze, with light brown foamy stable head. Visually low carbonation. 

Aroma: intense dark malts aroma, with notes of espresso coffee, cocoa nibs, slightly roasted and smoked, supported with hop aroma, which takes on dark fruits.

Flavor: as Aroma reveals, prevails dark malt flavors, which takes on roasted, espresso coffee, cocoa nibs and hint of smoked in finish. Malt flavor is supported with hop flavors, which takes on dark fruits. Finish is sticky dry and slightly bitter. Bitterness lingers long in aftertaste.

Body is full, texture is creamy smooth, carbonation is low. 

Another great dark beer brewed in this absorbing Brewery...
Dark black. Super thin head. Nice safe stout. Dry. Chocolate at the end. Tasted at Elijah Ps.
Pitch black but no head. Chocolate, porter like bitterness. Roasted malts flavour. Dry sweet finish
Pretty good brew, not sure where the head is but OK. Coffee and chocolate, a bit simple, but that doesnt mean bad.
33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark color. Thin brown head. Low to medium sweetness. Low bitterness. Aroma is nutty, chocolate, milky. So good!

Bottle. Black, small brown head. Intense aroma, espresso, chocolate, hints of black peper. Full body, low carbonation. Taste mainly chocolate porridge, bitter-sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate, meaty, coffee, taste is rich, chocolate, oatmeal, sweet.

Zapach średnio intensywny, gorzka czekolada, kawa, aromaty palone. Barwa ciemnobrunatna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana obfita, średniopęcherzykowa, szybko opadająca, ładnie zdobi szkło. W smaku wytrawne, ciemne słody, kakao, gorzka czekolada, paloność. Wszystko to dosyć intensywne, goryczka średnia, popiołowa. Wysycenie średnie, piwo bardzo fajne.

Sensoric. Bottle. Pitch black with medium, light brown head. Poor head retention, medicore lacing. Medium roasted malts aroma - milk chocolate, coffee. Crackery, charcoal and earthy notes. Taste is semi-dry with ligh bitter notes. Finish is dry, roasted and ashy. In genral good, solid stout with every feature that this style should have.
UPDATED: DEC 3, 2015 A fine oatmeal stout.  Not bitter. Great color, pour and aroma. Couldnt ask for much more.

Bottle from Malt Attacks, reading 7% ABV instead of 8% but I assume this is still the same beer. Dense and creamy, regularly shaped, medium thick, deep tan head over a jet black beer. Pleasant aroma of black bitter chocolate, coffee with cream, haemoglobin iron, black tea, dry liquorice, cloves, toasted brown bread, dried juniper berries, some smoked meat, nettles, espresso beans, pipe tobacco ashes, tar. Creamy onset with sharply but finely stinging carbonation, some candied fruit sweetness but only very subtly so, surrounded by salty (salmiak), sourish (brambleberry) and umami (black olive) accents; full, creamy and oily body consisting of a thick layer of nutty and roasted grains with a certain kind of deep, dull grainy sourishness to it (I guess this is the oats), becoming more and more roasted bitter in the end with a coffeeish aromatic quality to it but only mildly so, eventually a bit charcoal-like as well; finishes in a lot of roasted bitterness along with peppery hops which blend in nicely, a faint hint of warming alcohol but nothing too obvious, and a remaining sensation of thick, bittersweet malts. I like stout in all its substyles and these guys are clearly good at it: though not too outspoken in terms of character and personality, this one is more than decent, powerful roasted bitterness truly shines here, mouthfeel and looks are exactly what youd expect from a 7% stout and there are no flaws whatsoever. It would be unfair to compare this with their imperial stout (the popular Plead the 5th), but in its particular stout substyle, this shows the same technical perfection.

355ml bottle. Jet black colour with small to average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige to tan head. Roasty dark malty aroma with a nuttily touch, notes of milk chocolate, chocolate cookies, some dark chocolate, a touch of liquorice. Taste is slightly roasty dark malty, slightly sweet, hints of treacle, dark chocolate, a touch of liquorice, cautious hints of blueberry jam; oily texture. Perfectly hidden alcohol, dangerously drinkable.

다크호스 브루잉 - 원 오트밀 스타우트 8% ABV 기분 좋게 솟는 어두운 폼, 극단적으로 달거나 비터한것없이 자연스러운 가을/겨울의 시즈널 오트밀 스타우트. 로스팅 된 맥아에서 오는 초콜릿, 가벼운 커피의맛 

8도 치곤 무겁지 않은 맥주. 엠블럼만 세련되게 바꾼다면 평가가 한층 올라가지 않을까 싶다.

https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot

Bottle. Pours black with brown head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet, oats, roast, coffee, chocolate. Flavor is sweet, roast, malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Finish is roast bitter with some sweetness. Overall: very good.

Dark brown beer, small tan head. Nose is smooth roastiness, coffee and milk chocolate. Flavor has a lot more coffee and roast, sweetish and bitter, chocolate and coffee. Long roasty and bitter finish. Simple, but a gorgeous finish. Light, but flavorful.

Kolor: bardzo ciemnobrunatny, prawie czarny.
Piana: bardzo obfita, ale słabo zbudowana, średnio i grubo pęcherzykowa, strzela i szybko opada. 
Zapach: poro ciemnych słodów, gorzka czekolada, kakao, kawa, wyraźne aromaty palone.
Smak: wytrawne, niska pełnia, sporo nut ciemnych słodów, kawy, kakao, gorzkiej czekolady, wyraźna paloność, delikatna kwaśność, goryczka średnia w kierunku wysokiej, palona.
Wysycenie: wysokie, zdecydowanie za duże.

Nieprzejrzyście czarne, z piękną brązową pianą. Aromat to gorzka czekolada, mocno palona kawa, w tle delikatny sos sojowy i lekka kwaśność. W smaku mocno wytrawne. Mocno palone, dużo gorzkiej, deserowej czekolady. Finisz to średnia goryczka, pozostawiająca posmak ziaren czekolady. Piwo ok, ale nie jako sweet stout.

Black with thick tan head. Roasted aroma, notes of coffee and dark chocolate. Similar flavour. Starts off sweetish and then the long lasting bitterness takes over. Light mouthfeel but still quite flavourful.
Draught. Nice roasty stout with great dark chocolate, coffee and caramel flavours. Medium bodied, creamy and smooth. Very nice.

A black beer with an almost medium and light brown head. Aroma has dry roastiness, balancing sweet chocolate, some coffee. Great aroma. Taste has roasted coffee and nice chocolate, dry end. Medium+ bodied, smooth. Quite simple beer but thats not bothering as the basic elements are balanced. The great beer.

Versa color ebano, impenetrabile; la schiuma è alta due dita, molto densa, di un bel marrone scuro, la ritenzione è buona, che si riduce a un cappello sottile, leggera allacciatura. Aroma di cioccolato fondente, malto tostato, avena, caramello, e melassa; con un po di vaniglia e alcol. Alcuni aromi sono molto gradevoli, e dalla buona persistenza. In bocca inizia dolce, cioccolato fondente e farina davena, poi; malto tostato, caramello, melassa. Transizione ad unamarezza decente sul finale, con sapore di caffè. Palato cremoso e liscio, lalcool riscalda lievemente nel finale. Carbonazione media, ma senza togliere cremosità al palato, corpo medio-pieno.

3/VI/15 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a (2015-749)  
Clear dark brown to black beer, big frothy beige to brown head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: dried fruits, chocolate, malty, cacao powder, some mocha, sweet. MF: lots of carbon, medium body, smooth creamy texture. Taste: lots of chocolate, cocoa powder, bit sourish, little sweet, caramel. Aftertaste: roasted, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, fruity touch, caramel, coffee, pretty roasted, little sweet.
(bottle 18/06-2015) low brown head, black color, medium co2, rather long roasted taste. BB date 01.01.17 (drikkeriget).

Bottle. Purchased in fall 2011. Pours black with no head. Nose is licorice, vanilla, soy sauce, hints of bourbon. Mouthfeel is medium heavy. Coffee, cocoa, soy, oak. Very dense and almost no carbonation. Dry, slightly astringent finish. Not bad for a whale.
Dark brown body with a brown medium head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, some smoke, coffee. Taste is medium sweet with medium to heavy bitter. Medium body, dry finish, oily texture.
Tap. Very roasty, chocolate and coffee aroma. Dark black, nice lacing. Medium bodied, not so sweet.

Bottle sampled at Amager Bryghus, thanks to Papsø. Black with a medium sized brown head. Nose has charcoal and soft oats. Flavour offers earthy smoke, light salami, dark grain, wood, roasted malt, vanilla. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and bitter, long roasted finish.
12oz bottle. Pour is very dark . Head faded rather fast. Aroma of chocolate and roast malt. Strong flavour of rosted malt and coffee, Lots of coffee. Slight bitterness from the cocoa and vanilla.
Bottle. Black pour, brown head. Nice aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste of cacao, roasted malt, gritty coffee and a little vanilla. Very good.
Bottle. Black colour. Roasty coffee vanilla aroma. Roasty chocolate flavour, very nice stout
Black, medium brown head. Roasty oats, dark caramel and some coffee on the nose. Medium bodied, roasty bitter with sweet cocoa notes. Finishes bitter and warming. Great!

Bottle 12 fl. oz., Drink Hala, Wrocław, Poland.
Czarne, mętne piwo z ciemnobeżową, obfitą i puszystą pianą oraz przyjemnym, czekoladowym, lekko przypalanym aromatem. W smaku gęste i intensywne, wyraziście wytrawne, mocno palone i kawowe.

Poured deep dark brown with a disappearing beige head. Aroma of milk chocolate, berries and soft roast malt. Medium body, quite smooth, flavour as the aroma, coffee grinds, fudge. Dry, bittersweet finish.

Lukt: Kaffe, bek og lakris.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Nesten ikke skum, ring langs kant.
Smak: Kaffe og lakris.

Very good beer. Has a great mouth feel, nice presence. Taste really good, it is nice and creamy.
On tap at Delirium Café, how awesome is this? Pours absolutely gorgeous black with a brown big head that does not fade. Oatmeal, coffee, hints of chocolate, roast. Awesome oatmeal stout, love!

Bottle shared from Mi Orge Mi Houblon. Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, cocoa, toffee, caramel and malt. Flavor is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
chocolate aroma. Thin tan head. Clear deep burgundy aroma. Chocolate and coffee in the aftertaste

Draft @ Hoppy Loft.
Brune foncée, col crémeux café au lait.
Arôme offre un bouquet renforcé au niveau grains et avoine, doù ressort une certaine épaisseur. Note de café en retrait ponctué par une note de pâte de pâtissier.
Palais est malté, pointe davoine en épaisseur. Garde un côté caramel et café assez prenant et persistant. Un peu sec sur la fin voire poussiéreux et ponctué dun léger pétillant. Possible ajout de réglisse qui perce en fin de bouche.

Po przelaniu tworzy się nieduża warstewka zbitej beżowej piany, ładnie oblepiającej szkło. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie czekolada, kawa latte, trufle, prażone ziarno. Jest też delikatna siarka. Aromat bardzo podobny do Sweet Nygus z Solipiwko. W odczuciu piwo jest gęste, nisko nagazowane, bardzo pełne, ale nie wyklejające, ponieważ nie jest słodkie, raczej dość wytrawne jak na sweet stouta. Jest oczywiście lekka odsłodowa i laktozowa słodycz, jednak szybko kontrowana gorzką czekoladą, kawą espresso, nutami palonymi, korzenno-rumową goryczką na średnim poziomie. Nie ma kwaśności od ciemnych słodów. 
Jest to piwo z USA, czyli nie jest tanie. Warto jednak spróbować, ponieważ twórcom udało się tu połączyć pełnię RISa ze stoutową pijalnością. Nie jest to trunek wybitny, aczkolwiek bardzo dobry. Poprawa aromatu podniosłaby jego atrakcyjność.
bottle poured into a tulip glass..dark brown with a fluffy tan head..aroma of roasted nuts,coffee..dry,malty,roasty..better than i expected.

March 19, 2015. Tap at Babajan.
Black with a small creamy brown head. Aroma is roasted coffee, ash and some licorice. Taste is medium sweet caramel, dry ashy bitterness. Dry roasted ashy finish. Medium bodied, average carbonation.
Dark brown with medium light brown head. Dry roasted malt taste with some sweet touch and moderate lasting bitterness.

How: Draught.
Where: Babajan, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Malt, vanilla, fruit, some chocolate.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, malt, caramel, coffee, some alcohol.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, brown-black with a small tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of chocolate, roasted coffee and pumpernickel. 

Taste of roasted coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, pumpernickel and a touch of cured meat flavor. 

Medium/full body and medium/high carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pour at home split, thanks Andrew for sharing this one. Black pour thin head. Heavy coffee aroma and taste, slighty roasted, thick body. Nice beer here.

12 oz bottle poured. Pours a dense dark oil black with a dark brown head. Super thick body just looking at it. Syrup like pour. Mild coffee bean and rich chocolate malt aroma. Flavor is a lot of chocolate malt, and a bit smokey, which was a little surprising. Toasty towards the finish, and a little dry. Coffee throughout, but finishes a little empty. Overall a good, enjoyable stout, and look forward to drinking this again soon.
Keg at Babajan, Stockholm.  Black, beige head. Treacle and lingonberry. Sticky sweet with syrup and metal. Full bodied with rounded mouthfeel. Ashy, resiny piney finish. Sub par.

Strong coffee aromas, a touch of nutty flavor.

A bit of a creamy texture; a reasonably long finish with coffee and a bit of nut flavor.

What i like about this beer: coffee and nut flavors.

What I dont like: just a touch thin and not as complex as the best stouts.

Very dark brown, opaque pour with a giant, well-retaining, foamy Brown-10 head. Rich, smoky, griddle grease, and bacon aromas. Moderately thick with a surprising amount of carbonation. A strong metallic flavor tends to overpower The flavors that were detected in the aroma. There is a date/prune note in the flavor that was not earlier detected in the aroma.

W aromacie bardzo pełne, czekoladowy krem, lekka kawa, bardzo przyjemny. W smaku nieco gorzej, przez pierwsze sekundy czuć fajną, czekoladową kremową pełnie, a potem uderza popiół, paloność, przez co finisz jest pusty, szorstki i nieprzyjemny. Trochę szkoda.
Ciemno brunatny, ladna bezowa piana. W aromacie kawa, duzo kawy. W smaku ponownie kawa, dobra palonosc idealny balans.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with medium tan head which dissipates fast. Aroma of coffee, oats, light licorice, light ash and pumpernickel. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee, oats and toast. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Maybe a bit thin body. Nice stout.

From bottle. Pours black with a dark beige head and some lacing. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste is the same, with a gentle sweetness. Rich creamy mouthfeel. Very easy to drink and oh, so delicious.

Bottle @ Studenterhuset. Pours dark brown with a medium dark brown head. Aroma is pretty malty, chocolate, oats, some roast, some hosp. Taste is pretty sweet and bitter with some malts, chocolate and a nice amount of roast. Medium carb, slightly thin and oily body.

Appearance: near black, with a big, thick, frothy dark tan head and generous lacing.  Aroma: 	sweet milk chocolate, espresso roast, dark chocolate, light graham cracker. Taste: coffee and chocolate, hint of earthy grain, graham cracker, and vanilla.  Finish: smooth and roasty, with a lingering dry sweetness. Notes: Really enjoyable. Would drink again. Bottle from Total Wine in McLean, VA.

Flavor is chocolate, licorice and some citrus hop to help with balance. Unfortunately for me this beer wasnt balanced in my taste. Lots of bitterness. Very low carbonation, so low in fact it had a flat texture. Or maybe this didnt stand a chance since I had Bells Java stout right before it. I dont mean to say this is a bad brew in any sense. It just didnt live up to the two Bells offerings I had right before it. A nice thing is the ABV is hidden nicely. So overall, it still really is worth a try.
Bottle.  Poured a black color with 1 finger head.   Aroma is cocoa,some coffee notes, vanilla, lactose.  Heavy bodied.  Chewy.  Bitter finish.  Starts off sweet.  Creamy texture.  Not bad.

Bottle. Pours oil black with no head, no lacing. Aroma is roasted malts with a light tinge of vanilla. Taste is creamy, a bit chocolate, vanilla, like coffee with cream. Slightly bitter finish. Nothing great, but easy drinking.

35,5 cl bottle @ Olutkellari Helsinki (RIP) , Rated on 06.04.2010
Aroma has somewhat salty licorice, some coffee notes, hints of dark chocolate and soy sauce. Flavour is ashy with salty licorice, fruits, some dark chocolate, cocoa and distant herbal notes. Smooth but somewhat ashy finish. Like a mixture of foreign and sweet stout.
12oz bottle.  Pour is oily black with a tan head, near perfect looking.  Scent is decent, chocolately.  Taste is roasted coffee beans, nice bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Sweet lactic chocolate aroma. Black with a large creamy brown head. Roasty coffee and sweet chocolate flavor with a light roasty bitter finish. Full body, moderate carbonation. Very nicely done.

Trade from queenholly. Pours a dark brown with thick cream head...Smells or roasted oats and malts with hints of chocolate...very smooth beer taste of amazing roast, and did i mention smooth....great stout hope they get it to nd retail soon

well crafted Oatmeal Stout that is slightly muddled and off in the finish for the style. I get the oats but its finish is not quit what I look for in a oatmeal stout. Not a bad beer at all, but one I will not be in a rush to go back and get. Still enjoyed it though, Cheers!

Really blew me away on this one.  Hands down the best non-imperial stout I have had.  Pours a rich oily entirely opaque black with a dark mocha head - beautiful.  Smells of fresh coffee and bitter chocolate, very resinous hop presence - heavily roasted.  Feels brilliant - smooth, full, relaxed carbonation but still noticeable but not too much.  Wow.  Great stuff.

Ar: Bittersweet cocoa, coffee, and some ashy roast.
AP: Black, opaque - medium-small light mocha head with decent retention and a thin ring of foam remaining.
T: Roast and ash up front, coupled with a medium sweetness - cocoa and heavy roast coffee comes next, with some burnt caramel - medium bitterness with a slightly mossy flavor - lingering coffee.
P: Medium-full body, fairly smooth and lush - carbonation is high, medium-dry finish.
O: Good oatmeal stout - delicious mixture of roast, cocoa, and coffee flavors, plus it looks good in the glass and has a nice palate.

pours black with minimal head.no lacing to speak of.aroma of bitter chocolate and coffee.flavor is pretty much the same.medium carbonation,full bodied and a slick mouthfeel.you get that.bitter cocoa finish that can be expected from the style.way,way over-rated.

Bottle. Very good stout. Dry chocolate aroma, thick black pour, smooth, full body, easy finish with a little taste.  All around quite good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pour.  Nice aroma of chocolate and coffee.  Full-bodied, which is nice.  Tastes grainy and with a nice dark chocolate twang.  Aftertaste is a little bitter for a stout, for me.  Nice beer.

[4638-20120806] 12floz bottle. Roasted chocolate coffee dust aroma. Black body with a medium-lasting creamy tan brown head. Super roasted coffee flavour has a lightly sweet nutty chocolate finish. Full body. Quite tasty and drinkable. (8/4/8/3/16) 3.9
(w/ jercraigs)

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2012 Black colored brew. Bitter and vinegary. Maybe this one is infected or has been on the shelf to long because I see a lot of high ratings but this one is pretty sour.. This bottle doesnt come close to New Hollands Poet. Ill need to try another sometime. Drain pour.
Tap at the bywayer - pours pitch with a chocolate head. Aroma is a strong coffee, chocolate, and smoke. Taste is sweet. Palate is dry and thin for an oatmeal stout. Good, but average.
Draft at the Bywater. Pours black with a quarter inch of khaki foam. It leaves a bit of lacing. Nice coffee vibe on the nose. Fairly prominent roasted malt thing on the tongue. Clean finish. Solid!

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2013 Draft at the Khyber and later at Moriartys. Pitch black pour with an impressive brown foamy head. Black coffee. Burnt toast. Chocolate nibs. Dark toasted oats bring a nice fullness without bringing any lighter wheat beer notes. Lots of ashy flavors. Charcoal grill. Cigarettes. Some darker red fruit. Prunes. Raisins. Dates. Silky body. Nice dry finish. Very good oatmeal stout.

Pours oily black with a dark tan head.
Nose is dark chocolate roast and coffee.
Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate.....creamy oatmeal...
Strong coffee bitter...a trace of alcohol, but not boozy..
Very good....

12oz bottle - pours black with plenty of brown head and great lacing. Nose is roasted malts and coffee. Flavor adds chocolate. Sweet with a bitter finish. Medium body. Long bitter chocolate finish. Expectations were met.

on draft, pours dark black with mocha colored head that disappears quickly...no real lacing just a oily lacing type...the aroma is of coffee and deep roasted malts and possibly powdered chocolate. the flavor is strong on the coffee bitterness and the roasted malts and the chocolate and then goes back to the bitterness of the coffee...excellent stout for winter time.

Deep brown body, nearly pitch black. Plenty of tan head. Roasted malt and caramel in the nose is this brew's forte. Chalky, dry profile atop the dark roast. Much darker in flavor than most of its peers, even adding some tobacco. Solid, not outstanding.

Pours black, brown around the edges, with a thin chocolate brown head that dissipates to a ring and leaves some soapy lace. Nose involves toasted notes, hearty baked bread, a touch of mint, and some brown sugar. Taste is nicely sweet but pretty well balanced with bitterness. Fuller side of medium bodied, creamy, smooth, rich. Really nice oatmeal stout, easy drinking yet hearty. Dark Horse knows their stouts.
Bottle. Pours an extremely dark and thick brown color with a moderate tan head. Nose has both roasted coffee and chocolate notes to it. Taste is a tad sweet, but roasty and interesting. I like it.

Incredibly smooth and soft in light of the higher than average 8%.  I like that its understated, meaning its drinkable like a traditional oatmeal stout, but has the slow burn, sensual sucker punch of an imperial.  The aroma, predictably, is roasted malts and trailmix.  The body is thick and creamy.  The appearance is night-black with dark brown lacing and a very thin layer of foam on top. The taste is what you want for a late-fall beer: thickly layered oats and nuts wrapped in a toasted wood presence like a cabin hearth.  This is excellent stuff that doesnt need to be flashy to be great.
on tap @ Farmhouse in Chicago. Hearty near black pour, dense light brown head. Roasty, thickly malty, oaty, velvety mouthfeel, hard roasted bitter finish. Delicious.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Incredible aroma of coffee and chocolate with a dark black pour, surprisingly complex taste and modest mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark black color with nice thick, creamy, beige head that lingers a while.  Aroma is sweet cream, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, and marshmellow.  Taste is pretty sweet, lots of cream and chocolate, hints of coffee.  Very, very smooth finish.  Light spicy hops in the finish as well.  Moderately thick and chewy mouthfeel too.  Overall this is very tasty smooth stout.

2012-08-06. Dark black body with a nice creamy brown head that fades a bit. Aroma is pleasant but milder than expected for such a big beer. lightly dusty roast malt, modest dark malt and light cocoa undertones, muted alcohol. Dark malty flavour has a good amount of coffee like roast up front, rich sweet malty middle, dry bitter roast in the finish. Very lightly alcoholic, notes of dark chocolate/cocoa. Would like to see a bit more of the chocolate and less of the roasty bitterness for my own tastes. Smooth medium to full bodied palate has soft carbonation. Quite good, very well made imperial stout.  Bottle from Cloverleaf, Michigan, Cellared for a few months.
Aroma is malts and vinous.  The flavor is chocolate, dark fruit/vinous, coffee and a mildly sour/alcoholic finish.

Bottle at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration Tune-Up, London. Pours thick black with a creamy, beige head. Milky chocolate nose with some berries. Pretty big sweet flavor with rich chocolate, some tar and burnt wood. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Moderate roasted malts in the finish with lots of dark fruits, some dry charcoal, cocoa. Very, very nice.
Draft at railroad. Pours pitch black worth virtually no head at all. Aroma is mostly coffee with a little chocolate. Taste is on the sweet side with some milk chocolate and lactose. Solid.

Deep black pour with red brown thin red head. Very strong coffee scent with some chocolate, maybe hints of toffee too. Thick body. Bitter with lots of malt. Tastes of mostly malt. Toasty and woody and delicious. More delicious finish with the same flavor. Smokey mesquite finish.
Bittersweet chocolate at the forefront. Nice body but not nearly as oily and slick as I was expecting. A tasty lil beer. Enjoyable.

Bottle from trade. Here's a pairing for you... this oatmeal stout with Rold Gold Honey Wheat pretzels dipped in Nutella. Anyway, aroma and flavor of light-brewed coffee and bitter chocolate nibs. Some creamy thickness in the sip and palate. Just a great beer. Love it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Scopeys Pre-CBC tune-up. The beer pours deep brown color with no head. The nose is simple brown sugar with hints of forest fruits and lightly roasted grains. The taste is chewy strawberry malts, some dark-roasted coffee beans. Full coffee flavors dominate the taste. The finish is slightly hot and vinous. The bodys medium/full, the carbonation is light. Overall, quite nice, pleasing.

Bottle at my Pre-CBC Tune-Up Tasting, thanks to deeblo. It pours very dark brown, with a thin tan head. The nose is chocolate, touch of malt vinegar, soy sauce, cinnamon and roasted malt. The taste is roasted malt, charcoal, caramel, varnish, toast, coffee and alcohol warmth, with a dry, roasty finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. A flavoursome and well balanced beer.

355ml bottle from Cask Pub, London

Pours pitch black with a nice dark brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, licorice, milk and chocolate. Taste is roasty and slightly sweet with chocolatey notes, coffee and hints of milk. Finish is roasty and slightly sticky. Nice, well balanced sweet stout.

355 ml bottle.
Pours a black colour with a beautiful dark brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and some pepper. Flavour of roasted malts, coffee, pepper and oat. Medium bodied, oily mouthfeel and a dry, malty, coffee finish. Tasty!

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, dark black pour with dark tan head, aroma brings dark chocolate, coffee, toffee and caramel notes, touch of nice dark fruits, nice sweet hershey notes, hints of nice espresso and mocha, this smells great.  Taste is nice mix of chocolate, milk and dark, espresso bean notes, hints of roast, some slight mineral notes but not bad, finishing fairly sweet, roast dries it out well.  Nice brew.
Smells chocolatey.  Pours thick and black with beautiful dark brown head.  Leaves a ton of sediment behind in the bottle.  Minimal fizz.  Oily, burnt, bitter.  My first dark horse.  Not bad.

Dark black in color, hazy with a thin tan head.  Nice silky smooth aroma dark malt, coffee and toffee like aromas.  The flavors where smooth and filled with oats, chocolate, coffee flavors. Smooth easy drinking oatmeal stout.

my fav style - oatmeal stout!  been wanting to try this one - thanks to emeinz for the trade - super dark pour with dirty beige head.  aroma to me was alcohol with slight vanilla. mouthfeel was perfect - smooth and velvety.  taste was roasted stuff; slightes of vanilla maybe lactic - did I mention smooth; long lasting roasted flavor...niiiice.

Originally reviewed: 1/6/10. Poured into a pint glass. Pours a very thick, deep black. This is the darkest standard stout I have seen in awhile. Creamy mocha head rests on top. Retains fairly well, but leaves no lace whatsoever. Big roasted scents come out of this right away, but then they dissipate, and its a struggle to get much in the nose on this. Some mild cocoa tones mixed in, but faint. 

Like all oatmeal stouts, the body on this is creamy and smooth. Carbonation level is hidden well as this is just a velvety beer. Alcohol presence gives a good bit of body on top. Good mellow flavors come out with oats, chocolate, and dark bitter coffee aftertaste. This is a good stout right here. Its a little on the heavy side, so I wouldnt have many at a time, but its a good treat when I do.
Bottle - pours black with a light brown head that dissipates fairly quickly. Not much lacing on this one. Has a nice roasted coffee aroma and flavor to it and a thin but creamy mouthfeel.
12 ounce bottle. This is an amazing stout. Reminds me of chocolate cookies. A great roasted malt character, with a touch of fruitiness. Easy to drink, I would like another please.

Bottle pours black with a beige head. Aroma shows chocolate, coffee, and light roast. Flavor shows the same with additional notes of oatmeal and a touch of vanilla. Overall body is moderate, soft, and finishes with
a nicely balanced roasted bitterness.

Pours deep black with small brown head.  Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and caramel.  Taste is sweet with the chocolate and coffee canceling one another out.  Medium silky mouth feel.  Does not drink like 8%

12oz bottle in an English pint.  Pours very, very dark brown with a thick, tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts and grains, some chocolate, light coffee, and some light hops.  Flavor about the same, with lots of malts.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer.

On tap at Cobblestones
Aroma- roasted notes, cereal, some coffee, chocolate
Appearance- flat black, minimal tan head
Taste- big roasted notes, some chocolate sweetness, smooth finish with a touch of hop/oatmeal bitterness
Palate- just average, medium carbonation
Overall- Nowhere near as good as their Plead the 5th.  Just a run of the mill, higher ABV, stout that doesnt bring anything special to the table.

Pours thick and a deep black/brown.  Aroma of smoke, chocolate and burnt grain.  Taste starts malty sweet followed by smokey/peppery spice.  The taste ends and lingers with a roasted bitterness.  The oatmeal adds a nice amount of body to this one.

Home Run!  Dark Horse always brings their A game and its no different with their oatmeal stout.  Pours black with a thin, tan head.  Aroma is strong dark chocolate with hints of coffee.  Taste is robust with rich dark chocolate tones.  Like velvet on the palate with a medium to heavy body.  Smooth finish.  Overall, this is an excellent oatmeal stout.  First in a series of stouts from them and this one is hard to top.  Fantastic.
Bottle.  Completely black color, fine dark brown head with good retention.  Aroma of dark chocolate, brown bread.  Taste is pumpernickel bread, chocolate, dark roasted coffee.  Very nice.

Bottle. It pours dark brown/black and thick with a disappearing brown head. The aroma is dark chocolate, cocoa powder and hints of licorice. The flavor is full of coffee, dark chocolate and licorice. Full bodied and packed with flavor but utterly drinkable. The finish is very roasted and almost woody. Great beer.

12oz bottle from Downer Wine & Spirits. Pours a jet black color with a dark tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is bittersweet, chocolate, a little coffee, with a bitter coffee finish. A nice oatmeal stout.

Pours black w/ dense creamy tan head. Aroma roasty, sweet chocolate. Velvety mouth feel. Taste Sweet chocolate, coffee upfront with roasted middle to earthy/ash resin finish that sits on tongue. Very nice

Aroma is a bit sour or spoiled milk with notes of chocolate, oats, and roasted malt.  Taste is much better then the aroma.  No off notes at all just a very smooth velvety mouthfeel with rich roasty flavors and a medium sweet backbone.  Great stuff.

Pours black into an English pint. Tan head with good retention recedes to skim surface. Chocolate, coffee and earth aromas. Thin with dark earthy chocolate upfront turning to coffee in the lasting resin finish.

Bottle. Pour is black with a tan head, good retention/some lace. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roast, medicinal notes, some vegetal matter. Taste is roast, coffee, salsa/vegetal matter, light bitterness. Yikes. Palate is slick, mildly bitter finish.

Pours a thick black with dark tan head.  Smells rich, full of dark malt, and roasted barley, with a hint of coffee.  Taste is slightly sweet up front, but quickly fades to a smooth dark malt, leaving a bitter and slightly sour finish. No complaints here, as the taste rests nicely on my tongue well after the swallow.  Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Pours a dark black color with a caramel colored head.  Has an aroma of roast, caramel, citrus, and earthiness.   Sweet roasty caramel taste with a hop hit and some vanilla notes.  Creamy and tasty.

Very dark with a thinnish brown head. Aroma is roasty malt. Very full but not heavy. Flavors of malt, toast, nuts, and coffee. Smooth and satisfying finish. Very good, and lighter than the alcohol content would make you think.

12oz bottle. Totally opaque black color. Brown but minimal head. Spots and splotches of lace. Really good aroma. Big, thick mouthfeel. Creamy, but still with decent carbonation. Great, oat-y, roasty chocolate aroma. Nice, light bittersweet taste, very nice super-long delicious sweet aftertaste. Fantastic.

Poured from 12oz bottle.  Pours very dark brown, nearly black with a finger or so of tan head.  Aroma is charred wood and some coffee.  Taste follows the nose, there is a fair amount to smoked wood and just a bit of bitter coffee.

Black with a dark brown medium though thinning head.
Big roasted malt aroma smack in the face. milky chocolate, bit of cherry/raisin in there? Some woody hop as well.
Flavour is milk chocolate, roasted malt bordering on a bit of burnt astringency. Woody hop and lingering roasted malt finish. 
Body has a kind of light creaminess. Though I would like it a bit more full.

Pitch black coloured body with a thin deep brown coloured head and a pitch black body - no light escapes at all. Aroma of prunes, roasted malt, milk chocolate, raisins, yeast and plenty of deep sugars. Full-bodied; Assertive roasty malt flavour with a lot of oatmeal, some chocolate, a hint of coffee, a little nuttiness and a ton of caramel and other sweet flavours. Aftertaste shows a lot of roasty and bitter flavours with some oak and dry earth noticeable. Overall, a very nice and fulfilling beer with great tastes, some subtle flavours, but the bigger robust tastes really come out and play well - very complex and strong. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Merchants in Dearborn, Michigan on 16-January-2011 sampled at home in Washington on 15-November-2011.

Purchased at Armanettis in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a rainy cool Tuesday night after running and finding my new barber.  Appearance is a thick pitch black with a thin off white head that rims around the glass.  Aroma of roasted chocolate malt, oats, coffee, sweetness, very nice smell.  Taste is very smooth, more of a roasty / smoky quality in the flavor, retains all of the aroma elements, very light burn in the back from the alcohol.  Very good sweet stout.

Pours out black, yes indeed.  Dark brown but short lived head.  Smells great.  Smooth roast, chocolate.  Something is just really working for me with this one...  Flavor is good, again its really smooth.  Chocolate and roast, I mean what do you expect?  Its a stout.  But a fine one.  Body is pretty full.  Rich beer.  Touch of alcohol maybe, but its really hidden well.

Black with little head.  Chocolate, light coffee, dark fruits, light vanilla tones in the aroma.  Full, silky, syrupy body.  Flavor is chocolate, dark coffee, dark fruit, light booze, and a touch of vanilla.  Great beer.

Pours opaque reddish brown with tons of floaters and a dense dark brown head, incredible retention.  Aroma is chocolate, licorice, nuts, some dried fruit, coffee, but mostly chocolate cake.  Taste is bittersweet chocolate, rich dense oatmeal, roasted barley, coffee, nuts, some booze.  Body is full, creamy, low carb, rich full mouthfeel, dry coffee/chocolate finish.  Overall, this is what an oatmeal stout should be.

12oz bottle from Picks poured into an English Pint. Pours black with almost no head that disappears almost immediately. Aroma is wow alcohol. I can smell very slight hints of chocolate and coffee and vanilla, but mostly its like sniffing a bottle of Jack. Taste is lightly bitter. Very light chocolate but some nice dark coffee notes. I cant taste the alcohol nearly as much as I can smell it. Medium bodied with a thin texture. Soft carbonation and a long coffee finish. Overall, this beer is great. I would gladly drink this again in the future.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of bushmat1. Thanks Matt! Black appearance with a small brown head. Delicious aroma- dark chocolate, roasty malty, mild espresso, creamy aroma. Creamy, dark chocolate, sweet, roasty malty, light bodied, easy drinking flavor. Nice beer!
Dark brown with a small tan head. Malty and fruity. Malt, fruit, licorice and hops. Balanced, dry finish.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Black with nice purplish-tan head and some bubbly lacing.

Aroma: Roasted malts with chocolate, coffee, molasses, as well as some oats, dark fruit and English hops.

Taste: Semi-sweet molasses, oats, chocolate, plus just light touches of coffee and spicy English hops toward the end. Not as complex as the aroma.

Palate: Moderately low carbonation, creamy body but slightly coarse and thin. Barely dry finish.

Overall: Not as smooth or complex as expected for an Oatmeal Stout of this abv. Pretty good, but not a stand-out.

Aroma: coffee, chocolate, roast malts, caramel and some sweet malt notes.  Pours pitch black, little if any head.  Sweet, rich chocolate flavor; roasty and coffee notes, noticeable hop bitterness.  Chewy, creamy mouthfeel, full body and low/medium carbonation.
A tasty oatmeal stout. Very smooth and easy to drink. Really good stuff. I would buy again.
One word. Awesome! poured opaque from a bottle bought at Sicilianos in Grand Rapids, MI. Just what you would want from a stout and more. Competitors better keep and eye on Dark Horse.

Bottle at Schouskjelleren.
Black body with a small beige head.
Smells of milk chocolate, coffee and malt 
Taste is, rather surprisingly, as mild as it gets at first. After a while however, it turns up, huess it didnt enjoy the cold. 
When it shows up its a good mix of apricot, licorice, chocolate and coffee.
Decent bitterness, and really one to enjoy

0.355l bottle @ Ørsted Ølbar, Copenhagen. Pours a jet black body with a nice creamy fading chocolate head. Aroma is nice and chocolaty, roasted as hell with notes of dark coffee and some mild vanilla hints. Full-bodied, softly carbonated and has a creamy thick mouthfeeling. Really nice roasty flavors, a bit lactic and milky. Ends slightly sweet with a everlasting roasty and chocolate aftertaste. Top notch!

This stout pours out with the consistency and appearance of chocolate cola.  Head is small and fizzy.  Cant smell much but alcohol.  Its thinner than many stouts and delivers a bubbly bite to the tongue upon drinking.  The taste of alcohol is pretty strong at first but it leaves a yummy dark or bitter chocolate aftertaste.  Maybe taste some coffee flavors in there as well.  Overall, its a good beer but not great as I had expected from a Dark Horse brew.

Tasted on 5/22/11 from a 12oz bottle purchased at Lush Roscoe.  Pours opaque jet black with a thick brown head that recedes rather quickly to a thin collar of lace.  The nose is very roasted with bitter dark chocolate, coffee, hints of vanilla, and a bit of a smokey aroma as well.  The flavor is, once again, very roasted with tons of dark chocolate and coffee along with some molasses, savory smoke, and vanilla.  The body is full with average but stinging carbonation and a super long roasted dark chocolate and coffee finish.

Bottle from a generous trader. Pours dark oily black with deep brown head. Nose of oatmeal, roasted chocolate malt, vanilla and coffee. Very full. Taste is a bit grainy, lots of oatmeal and burnt chocolate malt. Some roast coffee and a hint of vanilla.

Poured from 12oz bottle, pours black with a decent tan head and some lacing through out the glass, aroma is full of chocolate with hints of coffee mixed in with it, the flavor has a nice backing of coffee that goes very well with the chocolate finish, somewhat of a thin mouthfeel but the flavor makes up for that, pretty darn good brew.
Nose is rich burnt malt, dark chocolate, cereal, wood, alcohol, feel is surprisingly thin, carb is medium, taste is fat malt, licorice, smoke, then iron and mediumweak hops finish
Very tasty dark and creamy. Hits the mark for all around great beer cant wait to have another.
Excellent head with the dark creamy mouthfeel.  There is a complex flavor profile that is roasty, yet smooth.

On tap at Local Option into a tulip...Thick dark brown pour with a light tan head, good retention...Sweet aroma with lots of chocolate, not enough oatmeal, a little roast...Taste is pretty good, sweet chocolate, lightly bitter, a touch of coffee, again not enough oatmeal, wish this was a lot more creamy.

Not bad, but nothing special.

A: The beer pours almost black with a finger of tan head sitting on top.

S: Plenty of coffee on the aroma along with lots of roasted malt and char.  A slight sweetness of chocolate and licorice, but theres some dark/bitter chocolate to it as well.

T: Lots of chocolate, particularly dark chocolate, and some cocoa powder.  Roasted malts and char, maybe some ash.  Coffee and a touch of oatmeal provide a bit of depth.  Very mild sweetness of toffee.

M: Medium in body with a moderate carbonation and a smoothness on the tongue.

O: This whole series of stouts has been pretty solid.  I enjoyed this one.

355mL thanks to TheTomG. Pours a deep brown to near black with a small, tan head leaving some sticky lace. But almost zero retention. Aroma is heavy molasses, burnt caramel, dark chocolate, licorice, roast, burnt cherries, creme brulee. Taste is very soft, heavy licorice bitter, massive dark chocolate and cocoa, biting sharp bitterness reminiscent of Bells Expedition. Ultra soft oatmeal palate. Very impressed.

Pours like used motor oil-black and thick.  Tall tan head vanishes quickly.  Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate is powerful, but not offensive.  Heavy roasted malt flavor with chocolate and coffee rounding out the taste.  This is a big beer!  Not sweet at all.  A slow drinker that is very enjoyable!

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured thick, black and oily with a large foamy dark brown head that lingered and left good lacing. Great viscosity with the beer really coating the glass. The aroma was sweet and toasty with strong chocolate and faint vanilla, coffee and eventually a bit of roastiness coming out. The flavor was semisweet, roasty and woody with moderate cocoa and light notes of vanilla and coffee. The finish was long, dryish and roasty with lingering Bakers chocolate. Thick and full bodied. Well done.

Not a bad oatmeal stout, just a little too bitter for my tastes, oatmeal stouts should be smooth and creamy, this was more like burnt coffee. not bad at all, very enjoyable, the abv is a little on the high side as well. I guess I compare all oatmeal stouts to sam smiths.
Full bodied very drinkable stout, liked it as much as the cream stout, highly drinkable and recommended

I received this bottle in a trade earlier this year (2009) and am just getting to it now. This bottle is at least a year old.

Pours a solid black color which lets no light pass. Vigorous pour could barely muster up any head at all. Smells vinous, a bit of dark fruit and roasted malts. Taste is of roasted malts, chocolate and a lingering coffee in the finish. Finish is a bit dry. Creamy smooth mouthfeel, medium body, low but ample carbonation. Great tasting brew, very creamy. I thought it finished a bit dry for my taste, but good just the same. Someone send me a fresh one please :)

Pours Black with dark brown edges and thin tan head. The aroma is roasty, mildly burnt, oatmeal sweetness, black licorice, some vanilla and some chocolate. The taste is rich, smooth and tasty. I get roasty and Smoke. I also get chocolate smoothness, coffee and sweet caramel. Wow, everything comes together nicely. Very very tasty brew. 8% ABV is well hidden.

Super dark pour with a nice brown head. The nose is very lactic, holding oat notes, and charred malts. The flavor is also quite roasty with lots of ash notes that lead to more lactic cream. Nice thick mouthfeel with a dry chalky finish.

Black pour with a small tan head. Aroma holds lots of lactic notes, oat, roast, and bitter chocolate. Flavor adds lots of charred roast and chalk, along with some espresso. Palate is a bit thin for 8%, but still very tasty. Good stuff!

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2011 12oz bottle into snifter...poors very dark basically black with a medium brown head. Smells good and chocolaty. Taste chocolate with a nice roasted finish. Lightly carbonated and goes down easy.

Bottle via lushawn. dark oily pour.  thin dark tan head.  Smells chocolaty with some oatmeal too...smells like its gonna be packing some sweetness as well.  Flavors are interestingly combined...the oatmeal giving it a very distinct characteristic with nice chocolaty maltiness riding along side it.  Tastes like a nice, smooth, easy to drink malted milkshake beer.  I like the flavors here.  The body is not as thick as I anticipated seeing it being poured into the glass, but medium-full body makes for easy drinking.

A delicious oatmeal stout. Aroma was sweet chocolate. Pour was a deep dark brown with a thin tan ring for a head. Taste was nice and sweet with big chocolate flavors and a smooth rich creamy oaty backbone. Sugary sweet aftertaste with vanilla and chocolate sticking on the sides of the tongue. Nice carbonation. Nice beer.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 33 cl bottle. Pours black with a big creamy beige head. Foam is good lacing and long lasting. Aroma is spectacular and intense: malty warmness with coffee, oat and spices. Palate is complex and evolving: coffe and chocolate sweetness at the beginning, bitterness with some spices later. Alcoholic and woody notes. Palate is excellent with a thick, creamy mouthfeel and a medium carbonation. Overall, very sweet but still astonishing.

pours black with a medium sized mocha head.  roasty aroma is somewhat subdued but has coffee, dark fruit, and bakers chocolate.  flavor is much sweeter than the aroma suggest and has notable coffee, some burnt toffee, and faint dark fruit.  mouthfeel is smooth and creamy...somewhat thick...with a long very roasty finish that almost tastes a bit burnt.

12oz. Pours super dark with a thin deep tan head. Great nose of chocolate malt, coffee, and subtle licorice.Medium bodied mouthfeel.  Roasted malt, coffee bitterness, oat, black licorice and a touch of alcohol. Tastes a little more like a coffe stout than oatmeal, but enjoyable.

From Bottle. 12oz. Pour pitch black. Thick, creamy looking, dark tan head. Aroma of malts, coffee, and caramel. Flavor upfront of Sumatra coffee. Mellowing out to chocolate with hints of raisins. Full bodied. Chewy mouthfeel.

At eight percent alcohol, this is basically an imperial stout though RateBeer has it classified as a sweet stout as of December of 2010. It certainly looks the part anyway w/ an opaque black color and brown head. The nose is of strong coffee and a bit of chocolate. Its not overly complex but quite smooth and nice. Flavor is similarly easy going though albeit w/ a sort of gypsum/mineral note way in the background that is a little distracting. The texture is creamy and mildly carbonated. Finishes rather sweet w/ a good bit of bitterness to balance but nothing overbearing. Well, I suppose this is a bit mild for an American interpretation of an imperial stout but, who cares, its better than most of them anyway.

Opaque black with a medium tan head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of roasted malts, oatmeal, smoke, coffee, and dark chocolate. Taste of oats, smoked malts, lactose, roast, coffee, and chocolate. Velvety mouthfeel.
12oz bottle. Deep dark pour with a dark tan head. Thick and chewy texture. Nice amount of sweetness with chocolate and licorice. This is a great stout.

Pours a dark brown almost black hue with a light brown head. Aroma a nice sweet blend of chocolate and coffee. Taste a tad light but a solid taste of sweet chocolate  with a slight smoked flavor. Very good Oatmeal Stout recommended.

Pours an opaque black with a big tan head, slowly fades and leaves very nice lacing,.. Burnt roasty aroma with dark fruits and chocolate... Creamy, roasty, burnt flavor not nearly as fruity as the aroma with subtle notes of chocolate and coffee, very nice flavor, decently complex... Lively, medium bodied, somewhat dry finish...

12 oz. bottle from International Beverage in Grand Rapids, MI.  Pours black with a very thin cinnamon brown head.  Aroma of licorice, roasted malt, and dark chocolate.  Smoky roasted malt and rich dark chocolate are at the front of this beer which finishes with just a touch of light hop bitterness.  This one pushes the boundaries of the stout category and almost ends up as an Imperial Stout.  Its a great beer as is but my guess is a little barrel aging would put this one is a world class category.  A great stout.

12oz bottle courtesy of iceicebaby on BA. thanks, sean! pours a silky, jet black with a smooth, dark, brick-brown head and light lacing. aroma is great with big roasted barley, dark malts, charred cocoa, and light soy with hints of ash and black coffee. flavor is delicious as well with bitter chocolate, dark fruits, and tobacco notes up front backed by smooth, rolled oats, roasted malts, cold coffee, and earth. palate is wonderfully smooth with light carbonation and a ligering, roasty finish. overall, another damn tasty brew from this series.

Bottle. Brought back from my trip to Michigan, for RBSG. Pours black, thin tan head, Nose is oats, lightly metallic, nice creamy notes, some licorice and earth. Flavours are well put together, fairly seamless, with the earthy rich oats sitting atop a nice roasty base, plenty of cocoa and tartness here too. No trace of alcohol, nice sausagey/smoky notes in the finish. Nice.

Pours black with a tan head. The aroma has milk chocolate, cream, coffee, oat and soy. The flavor had milk and bitter chocolate, cream, red berries, soy, and a hint of spice. Pretty tasty but a bit watery.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 It pours dark thick coffee black with a big creamy dark cocoa head.  The aroma is light roastiness, brown sugar, and sweet malts. It has flavors of coffee, roasty bitter chocolate, boozy, and a little licorice in the end.  It feels medium and smooth in body, with a light velvetiness. Rerating, the bitter roasted coffee is dominant in flavor and there is virtual no alcohol presence at all, it is very smooth in that aspect.

G: Poured into a 16-ounce pint glass with the University of Illinois logo.

A: Pours a thick, dark chocolate color with a cinnamon-colored head. Quite a bit of carbonation; you can hear it fizzle as it settles in the glass.

S: Rich malt with scents of dark chocolate, followed up by increasing hints of oatmeal. Sweet liquor.

T: Very nice malt up front, coming in alongside semi-sweetened notes of chocolate. Slight hints of coffee--more in the minor acidic quality than in actual flavor, though its there. Quite good, but the chocolate flavor dominates a little too much.

M: Very smooth and medium-bodied. Mild carbonation. Goes down well with only the slightest hint of alcohol. 

D: Definitely drinkable, especially for the style. The lighter body makes for a beer you can definitely have more than one of at each sitting. Im becoming more and more impressed with Dark Horse brews. This is yet another Ill have to plan on picking up a four-pack of.

Black pour tan creamy head ....  aroma of sweet malts, chocolate and roasted malts and lactose .... silky and sweet mouthfeel oily taste of roasted malts, chocolate and sweet lactose with a dry bitter roasted finish ... a sweet and great looking stout but just right can still detect chocolate and nice roasted coffee qualities .... good stuff
Nice pour, thick and viscous with a nice aroma. Wonderful flavor with hints of chocolate and coffee. An excellant stout.
Aroma is of coffee and roasty dark malts.  Medium bodied and lightly sweet with a wee o chocolate on the finish.  One of my favorite stouts...love these guys!

12oz bottle thanks to jeffo..
Appearance : Pitch black with tiny head gone very fast.

Aroma : Intense dark chocolate and roasted malt. Some liquorice and coffee. Very rich. Some hops too. Some liquorice.

Taste : Roasted malt with dark chocolate and hops. Finish is very nice roasted malt and dark chocolate. Some hops. Light dark chocolate bitterness. Rather dry.

Overall : Wow very nice finish. i like that dry mouthfeel reminding me of dark chocolate. Absence of head is a bit disappointing. Carbonation is very soft even a bit flat especially after 20 minutes in the glass. Very nice finish.

Draft sample at the Michigan Brewers Guild Fall Fest.  Dark brown/black with tan head.  Aroma of roasted coffee, chocolate, and sweet dark fruits.  Taste is bitter and lightly sweet.  Mouthfeel is medium and creamy.  Nice stout.

Bottle, 12oz. Its a black beer with a small, tan head. Looks decent but nothing more. The aroma has umami, chocolate, coffee and a touch of molasses. A quite meaty flavor also has chocolate and coffee, as well as molasses. Its full-bodied, oily and quite dry on the palate. Lacks on hoppy bitterness in the finish I think. A nice beer indeed, but Id like to have lower levels of molasses. 100521
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is licorice, coffee, vanilla. flavour is licorice, coffee, smoked, vanilla, chocolate. medium to full body. Nice beer.

Picked up at Sicilianos in Grand Rapids. Poured out totally black with a very creamy medium brown crown and slow moving silty lacing. The aroma is one of sweetness and softness. Chocolate, toffee, vanilla, mild berry, weak yet rich coffee and milky and maybe.. maybe a hint of cinnamon. Smooth and mellow flavours of chocolate (mediumlyishnessry bitter), mild coffee blended in very very well, vanilla, milk chocolate, berry taste on the finish.. hey - this tastes very similar to the aroma with the aroma winning out with its sharper character of roast and bigger chocolate. Very velvety smooth brew that leaves a wonderful coating everywhere. Finishes out with more chocolate. Just noticed that this is 8% - wow - youd never know unless you drank 6 or 7 quickly. Then the puke would be legendary.
Rich dark color with a brown head - similar to Palo Alto. Cinnamon and brown sugar notes; off dry with a long delayed pleasant coffee finish with a pleasant alcohol burn.

Bottle 33 cl. @ home. Deep black and fascinating color. Wow!!! One of the best black Ive ever seen on a beer. Not a great foam, but a nice coffee cream tone. Sweet aroma full of brown and burned sugar, caramel, banana, syrupy, raisins, coffee and oatmeal. Pleasantly fizzy. A little viny introduction for a very thick full body. Vanilla and dark chocolate, bitter orange, a strawberry hint, roasted malt and sugar again; *too* sweet, perhaps, and hard to drink entirely. But its so nice the viny aspect that surface and dominating the aroma with a delicate boozy and alcohol note. A very good strong stout, lack something in a not so interesting finish (that last indeed).

Black colour, small beige head, that leaves some lace. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and mild caramelly notes. Flavour is identical, but ends in a rather bitter way.

Bottle thanks to ditmier for sharing. Pours out black topped with a small tan head. Aroma is milk chocolate, rich malts, coffee, and little hop. Taste more of the sweetness from the chocolate, molasses, lots of roast malts, and the light coffee hangs on at the end.

12oz bottle. Pours a thick looking, pitch black body with a thin, creamy, dark brown head that dissipates quickly and leaves a moderate lacing. Aroma is very thick and rich with lots of chocolate and brown sugar. A light roast in the background with lots of smooth oats along with a light licorice and hint of soy. Flavor is more the same, but really drinks well. Im digging this. It has a ton of flavor, but doesnt have that thick feeling I was anticipating from the aroma. Lots of rich chocolate and brown sugar up front again, but more of a deep caramel flavor too. The roasts come out in the middle along with a touch of burnt coffee. They seem to balance the flavor much better than the aroma. Smooth oats, some licorice, and a hint of acidity that guides this into the finish where a light, earthy hop bitterness comes into play. The hops help dry this out along with the roasts before I get a hint of smoke in a lengthy aftertaste. Very smooth, medium body with a light carbonation that helps accentuate the flavors and makes this feel very rounded. Overall, a very nice oatmeal stout. Lots of rich malts with a very nice roast balance. The light earthy hop and smoke really makes the flavor stand out to me. Very smooth and easy drinking without a hint of the 8% ABV. I liked this one.

Bottle thanks to the awesomeness of CanIHave4Beers.  Pours midnight black with smallish medium-light brown head.  Nose is rich with chocolate and roasty oatmeal/barley.  Sweet coffee notes as well.  Taste also shows rich dark caramel, dark chocolate, and toffee notes.  Rich palate.  Hell of a beer.

Upon pouring this I could smell its pungent aroma from a few feet away. A very rich chocolate and coffee combination. Has a sweetness to the aroma, as well as a thickness. Poured dark black with no head. Big coffee taste with medium bitterness. Medium oily body.

Bottle. Pours a blackcolor with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma with some weak hints of coffee. Roasted malty chocolate and licorice flavor with some hoppy bitter hints. Has a roasted malty bitter chocolate finish.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black beer with a creamy lightbrown head. The aroma is soft and rounded with roasted malt and licorice. The flavor is roasted, rounded, licorice and sweetness. The palate is very smooth. Overall a really good beer.

33 cl bottle from Ølbutikken in sweet Copenhagen. Pitch black pour with a fizzy dark inch high head. The nose  is primary roasted and malty but with sweet coffee notes and some mild caramel and vanilla - maybe served a bit too cold which calms down the aroma. The taste is again dominated of the roastedness that leaves a both smokey and bitter impression that stays long in the finish The palate is medium on the light side. SOme faint yeasty and hoppy notes. OK beer

Bottle. An opaque black beer with an average sized, frothy, fully diminishing brown head. The aroma is nice, but not really powerful, moderately malty and lightly hoppy, with notes of roasted grains, milk chocolate, berries, grapefruit and a hint of coffee and alcohol. The flavour is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately sour, lightly bitter. Medium body, lively carbonation, long finish with medium bitterness, lightly alcoholic. The aroma is a bit shy, but nicely fruity, the taste is quite balanced. Nice one.

Pours black, the dark mocha head fades quickly to thin but viscous lacing.  Boozy nose, incredibly rich, chocolate, coffee, lactose notes. Hints of dark fruits. Simply a gorgeous aroma. Great on the palate as well.  Full mouthfeel, lively carbonation, crisp, finishes really clean with just a lingering note of how good it was.  Sweet, savory, with enough bitter to balance things out. Awesome beer.

Thanks to walt for sharing this bottle. The beer pours a black color with a tiny brown head that quickly dissipates. The aroma is chocolate with some soy and alcohol. The flavor is chocolate, tobacco and leather. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

bottle poured a dark black in color with a coating of true dark brown head. aroma has dark chocolate, rich malt, molasses, and some  mild oxidation. smooth feel is heavy and coating with a chocolate residue. flavor has a bit more roast, bitter chocolate, thick chewy malt, and some licorice. there is some sweetness in the back but this is really surprisingly thick and chewy.

Bottle. Pitch black with a medium tan head. The aroma is roasted barley, bourbon, chocolate and sweet caramel. Nice roasty flavour with notes of chocolate, liquorice, light coffee and tobacco. Medium bodied. It ends up quite roasty and chocolate caramel like.

(12oz bottle thanks to mar from Walt) very dark clear brown with no bubbles. Nose of fudge and sweet chocolate. Taste of dark chocolate, oats, lightly bitter, cream with a thin, roasty undercarbonated body.

Pours black with thin pink/yellow/tan head.  Aroma is dark roasted malts, coffee, molasses - very nice.  Light carbonation.  Tangy roasted malt that is smooth and silky.  Semi-dry, sour finish with plenty of malt bitterness and smooth hop bitterness.  Coffee aftertaste.  Full body.  A solid stout.
Old bottle thanks to walt. Pours with a small tan head and a deep brown body. Aroma of soy sauce, brown sugar and chocolate. Taste is oatmeal, soy, chocolate, roast, tobacco and salt. Light bubbles.

Pours a black color with a brown head. Aroma is sweet with caramel malts, molasses, chocolate, roasted malts, and some alcohol. Flavor is pretty much the same with some bitterness and slight warming on the finish. Overall pretty good
Black colored brew. Dark chocolate, malty aroma. Flavor is medium bitterness, oily feel, some roast and oat.

Sipping on this as I type... poured from the bottle into a Dogfish Head signature glass...

Very dark brown with a small amount of brown bubbly head that dissipates quite quickly, but leaves a nice ring around the glass with just a little bit of lacing.

Aroma is primarily roasty & nutty but the taste is a bit more complex, containing notes of molasses, roasted coffee, and a slight bit of chocolate.  The only aspect of this one Im not really enjoying is that its a bit bubbly and light - I prefer something a bit more chewy.

All in all this is a more than solid oatmeal stout and a beer I would certainly try again.

Courtesy StFun. Pours a very dark and opaque brown almost black color topped by a small, foamy tan colored head that recedes quickly and rejoins the body. The aroma shows quite a bit of rich, dark chocolate malts, roasted barley and coffee, and a touch of vanilla sweetness. The flavor follows with more dark chocolate and roasted barley up front then notes of dark fruit and vanilla cream come through. The oatmeal seems to balance things out nicely. Full bodied and creamy on the palate from the oatmeal with balanced carbonation and some roasted chocolate on the finish. This is a tasty stout, and one I could drink regularly if it were available.

12oz Bottle. Thanks Sean! Deep, dark earthy aroma of pancetta, hazlenuts, dark chocolate ganache, and whipped cream. Dense, rich, and luxurious. Pours an oily black mahogany with a creamed coffee foam. This beer has a lot of great flavors, spanning the whole stout family, without feeling too packed, like some Imperial Stouts. Crisp dry oaty and sea salt flavors mingle with sweet cookie-like characters before sliding into a heavily sugared cup of espresso bean with a good chocolate bar on the side. Flavorful, rich, deep and wonderful. This whole Dark Horse stout series really rivals lots of stouts. And, dare I say, I like this set more than the Bells stouts.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Completely black with a fine, creamy, beige head that slowly fizzes away. Sweet chocolate aroma, light milky, some roasted notes and fine hazelnuts. Low carbonation, fine dry and nice creamy texture. Flavour has lots of roasted malts, light milky chocolate, some viniousness, ashy and quite dry. Very drinkable for its ABV. Nice.
Bottled. Dark, short brown head. Chocolat, oatmeal, hint of rye, roasted malt. Bitter taste. Great balance. Good stuff.

Dark brown look with a brown foamy head. Classic roasted stout aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malts. Medium roasted bitter flavor, very clean and inviting without any suprises. Finish is sleightly bitter and warming.
Black with a small tan head. Aroma of licorice and smoke with a hint of mint. Dry and roasted flavour with smoke and chocolate. Soft carbonation and full body.
Pours black with a small light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and light smoke. Flavour is roasted malt, malt acidic, chocolate and light smoke.

12oz bottle via trade thanks to deliriumfest on BA.  Dont know how old this bottle was, but I suspect it may have had a little age on it.

Pours darkest brown but clear with a small tan head.

Aroma is very nice with roasted malt, caramel, and lots of chocolate. 

Flavor starts off good - roast, caramel, and chocolate - but the finish has some cardboard, maybe from oxidation.

Smooth but a little thin on the palate.

A decent oatmeal stout overall, but not quite as good as I was hoping it would be.  Drinkable at least.

Dark, deep and rich brown, no headn, minimal lacing. Smells of oats, sweet maltiness,  and roast coffee. The taste is sweet at first, chcolates, coffee/mocha, a very slight bitterness in the finish. Nice.

One (of four) purchased at Tiffanys in Kalamazoo last summer.    Aroma isnt giving up much, some mild roasted notes, a bit of soy sauce and some fig notes.  This carries the sweetness well, but since it might be about a year old it has a nice earthy age to it.  As this warms up in the mouth there are some slight clove and cinnamon notes as well as a thick roasted feel to it.

bottle pours a thick black with a medium dark tan head.  Aroma is black cherry, wood, lots of alcohol and some chocolate.  Flavor is dark, rich, mildly fruity and delicious.  Roasted barley, bakers chocolate, cherry syrup, some booze in the finish.  This stout rocks!
Typical stout appearance...not much head. Rich sugary coffee and cocoa aroma. Nice roasted barley character with hints of coffee and some brown sugar like sweetness.

Thanks to JaBier for sharing a bottle, part of a One through Plead the Fifth horizontal tasting. Pours black with a medium dark brown head that recedes steadily. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of toffee, malt and chocolate. Medium, smooth body with flavors of burnt malt, coffee, dark chocolate and a hint of vanilla. The finish is roasty with a coffee aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Pours black and dark with a brown head that quickly dissipates. Aromas of chocolate, espresso, a touch of vanilla, alcohol, and fine leather. The palate is oily and slick (syrupy as it warms), full-bodied, a touch of carbonation, and a long-lasting finish. The flavor is sweet with chocolate malt and oats with a medium roasted coffee bitterness. As the beer warms the alcohol and sweet malt profile emerge.  There are some similarities to the Founders Breakfast Stout, but less bitter.  Very enjoyable!

Flaske: Kulsort øl med et meget lille brunt skumhoved. Mangler en smule karbonering. Duften er tørret frugt og brændt malt. Smagen er brændt men med en smule surhed fra gæren, da den ikke er inficeret. Surheden ville fungerer bedre med en smule mere karbonation. Ikke en af de bedre fra Dark horse.
Darker black pour, notes of roasted malts, chocolate, light coffee. oily medium mouthfeel. Flavor was spot on, roasted malts, chocolate. Very balanced & well executed

Botella. Pitch black colour, deep dark brown hue. Nice brown medium creamy head. Roasty maltiness and dark fruits in the aroma with chocolate, coffee and bit of alcohol. Very good mouthfeel. Sweet flavour with lots of roasted malt, dark fruits, liqourice, coffee and some chocolate.
Bottle from The Cracked Kettle, AMS. Black with a small, beige head. Vanilla and intense chocolate aroma. Milky chocolate, hints of oaky vanilla. Alcohol. Medium body, flat. Very good.

This one poured very dark with a small short-lived head.  The leading malt profile was chocolatey with a slight gypsum mouthfeel and followed cleanly with just the right amount of sprucelike hops.  No worchestershire sauce aftertaste like some stouts.  Very good.
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

text: Bottle from Tiffanys. Black colour, brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, bit of sweet cocoa. Flavour of roasted malts, coffee. Fairly bitter, slightly sour, fairly dry dry finish. Decent.

bottle shared by faroeviking
dark, dark , dark brown, small borwn film head.
aroma if roasted grains, chocolate, licroice. Not so strong, but quite well blended.
flavor is roasted grains, malts, faint charchoal, coffee, dark caramel. Nothing out of the ordinary. palate is a bit thin.

Bottle at home. Pours an opaque black with a diminishing beige head. Smells of coacoa and rolled oats. Sweet with aromas of chocolate. caramel and some residual sugars. Also hints of vanilla. Hints of toasted malts towards the finish. Full flavoured yet only medium to full bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Dry and sweet finish with some aromas of dark chocolate and tiny hints of burnt malts. Good.
